title: Complete i18n coverage for Admin area and Bench history view

requirements.text: Localize the Admin page header and tab labels by replacing hardcoded strings in `frontend/src/pages/Admin/AdminPage.tsx` with `useI18n().t(...)` keys (Admin title, description, and the tabs: Benches/Documents/Users).

quotes: Cest presque bon. Mais tout l'onglet Administration n'est pas traduit. Idem pour les sections quil contient comme Documents ou Benches ou Users.

acceptanceCriteria: When switching app language, the Admin page title, description, and the three tab labels update immediately without a refresh.
No user-facing English/French literals remain in `AdminPage.tsx` for these strings (they use `t(...)`).

requirements.text: Localize all remaining user-facing strings in the Admin panels (`frontend/src/pages/Admin/components/AdminBenchesPanel.tsx` and `frontend/src/pages/Admin/components/AdminDocumentsPanel.tsx`), including: loading states, empty states, section titles/descriptions, dialog titles/descriptions/buttons, fallback texts (e.g., missing AGILE code), and toast success/error messages.

quotes: Mais tout l'onglet Administration n'est pas traduit. Idem pour les sections quil contient comme Documents ou Benches ou Users.

acceptanceCriteria: All visible text in the Benches and Documents admin panels is translated via i18n keys, including confirmation dialog text and toast messages.
Switching language updates these labels and messages immediately.
No untranslated strings such as "Loading benches...", "Bench Management", "Delete Bench", "Loading documents...", "Document Management", etc. remain in those files.

requirements.text: Ensure the bench history view is localized when viewing a bench after clicking “View details”: in `frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/BenchHistoryList.tsx`, display localized labels for history entry actions (and any other user-facing history strings) instead of rendering the raw `entry.action` text directly. Implement a robust mapping that can translate existing stored action strings (e.g., previously-written values) and falls back to the raw string if unknown.

quotes: Idem quand on accede a l'historique dun banc après avoir cliqué sur voir les details.

acceptanceCriteria: In the Bench detail page > History tab, the action line shown for each history entry is localized according to the current UI language.
Existing history entries already stored in state remain readable and are translated when a known action mapping exists.
Unknown/unmapped actions still render (fallback) rather than breaking the history list UI.

requirements.text: Use the current app language/locale when formatting timestamps in the bench history list so dates render according to the selected language (e.g., `toLocaleString(currentLocale)`), rather than the browser default locale.

quotes: Idem quand on accede a l'historique dun banc après avoir cliqué sur voir les details.

acceptanceCriteria: Bench history timestamps change formatting appropriately when switching between supported languages (French vs English), without requiring a refresh.

requirements.text: Extend the i18n key set in `frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts` to include all new Admin and history-related translation keys required by REQ-1/REQ-2/REQ-3, and provide values for both `fr-FR` and `en-US`. Use English text for the `en-US` values.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript compiles with the updated `TranslationKey` union including the new keys.
Both `fr-FR` and `en-US` dictionaries contain the new keys with appropriate translations.
No runtime `Missing translation`/undefined text occurs for the Admin area and bench history view.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only shadcn components).
Do not edit immutable hook entrypoints listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead).
Backend must remain single-actor; no new backend services/databases.
nonGoals: Adding new Admin features or changing authorization logic.
Changing the persisted language mechanism beyond what is necessary to translate the specified screens.
Rewriting backend history storage format (unless explicitly required to fix localization; prefer frontend mapping for existing stored history).
